page.title: 07ECOLOGY
page.content: ECOLOGY There is a fair range of habitats within our study area, some natural others man made. The River Roden, a narrow non navigable waterway flows quite fast so there are few surface plants but the banks are lush and overhung by trees notably Alders and Willows. The woodland in our area is largely manmade and carefully managed on behalf of Sir Algernon Heber-Percy, who in turn leases the land from his father-in-law Lord Leverhulme. They are mixed woodlands, well coppiced and managed by a gamekeeper who informed us that there is an abundance of badgers and foxes despite frequent hunting by The North Shropshire Hunt. Within our area is a fairly undisturbed area of common grassland which is home to rabbits and other small mammals.
